item.title: bigPint: A Bioconductor visualization package that makes big data pint-sized
item.description:
Publishing date: ‘2020-08-18’

Published on: ‘PLOS Computational Biology’

summary: ‘bigPint is a software package for interactive and static data visualisation in R. It scales comfortably to large datasets, sporting graphs that include scatterplots, violin plots, and litre plots. It’s installable via Bioconductor, and as an open source project it also provides an easy-to-use landing page that summarises all the links a new user or developer might wish to find, from “getting started”, to source code url, package version, maintenance status, example use-case code, supported R version, author contact details and bug reporting. '

authors: ‘Lindsay Rutter, Dianne Cook’

link to paper: ‘10.1371/journal.pcbi.1007912’

Icons made by catkuro from www.flaticon.com
